newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany to sell its old submarines to Indonesia.
newsitem.headline: Germany to sell its old submarines to Indonesia.

text.p: Germany's defence ministry said on Saturday Bonn wants to sell four submarines used by the German navy to Indonesia and the two countries were negotiating over the price.
A defence ministry spokesman confirmed a report in news magazine Spiegel released ahead of publication on Monday that the submarines were due to be delivered to Indonesia by the end of next year.
The German government sold two submarines to Indonesia in the early 1980s, Spiegel said. After unification in 1990 it sold a former east German warship to Indonesia.
German arms trade with the southeast Asian nation has been sharply criticised in the past by human rights groups because of the situation in East Timor which was annexed by Indonesia in 1976.
The United Nations Human Rights Commission formally criticised Indonesia this week in a resolution expressing deep concern at reports of killings and torture in East Timor.
